title: The Creation of Man and Woman
summary: Genesis 2 gives a closer look at how God created humans. It shows the special relationship between God and people, and how man and woman were created to live in harmony with God and each other.

faq.question: Why does Genesis 2 repeat the creation story?
faq.answer: It zooms in on the creation of humans, showing their importance and how God personally formed them.

faq.question: What is the significance of the Garden of Eden?
faq.answer: It was a perfect place where God and humans lived in close relationship, showing His desire to be near us.

faq.question: Why did God say it's not good for man to be alone?
faq.answer: God created us for relationship â€” not just with Him, but with each other. Eve was made as a companion for Adam to show partnership and love.

faq.question: What does the phrase 'one flesh' mean in verse 24?
faq.answer: It refers to the deep unity of marriage. In ancient Hebrew culture, marriage created a new family unit where emotional, physical, and spiritual oneness was expected.

faq.question: What cultural view of marriage is reflected here?
faq.answer: Marriage in Genesis 2 is covenantal and foundational. Unlike transactional or political marriages common in ancient cultures, this text shows marriage as a sacred union ordained by God, centered on companionship and mutual support.
